title: British Prime Minister Sunak: China is the ‘biggest state threat’ to economic interests
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak sat down exclusively with Lester Holt in his first U.S. TV interview since taking office to discuss China’s growing threat in Europe, King Charles taking the throne and more.

title: U.S. and allies partner on 'submarine of the future' in bid to counter China
description: The heads of the United States, United Kingdom and Australia announced an agreement Monday that would provide Australia with nuclear-powered submarines.

title: López Obrador says Mexico is safer than the U.S.
description: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said his country is safer than the U.S. following the kidnapping of four Americans; two of them died.

title: Nicaragua proposes suspending relations with Vatican
description: Nicaragua ’s government proposed suspending relations with the Vatican following comments by Pope Francis condemning the crackdown against the Catholic Church.

title: Iran says 22,000 who were arrested in protests have been pardoned
description: Iran announced Monday that the country’s supreme leader has pardoned 22,000 people arrested in the recent anti-government protests that swept the Islamic Republic.

title: Thirty migrants missing in shipwreck off Libya as charity blames Italy
description: Thirty people are missing and 17 were rescued in the central Mediterranean on Sunday after the boat in which they were travelling from Libya capsized in bad weather, Italy’s coastguard said.

title: South African rapper Costa Titch dies after collapsing during music festival performance
description: South African rapper Costa Titch has died after he collapsed on stage during a performance at a music festival over the weekend.

title: Japan’s Kenzaburo Oe, awarded Nobel for poetic fiction, dies
description: Nobel literature laureate Kenzaburo Oe, whose darkly poetic novels were built from his childhood memories during Japan’s postwar occupation and from being the parent of a disabled son, has died.

title: From Michelle Yeoh's mom to India, historic Oscar wins spark joy across Asia
description: Movie fans across Asia celebrated on Monday after some history-making moments at the Oscars, as Michelle Yeoh became the first Asian to win best actress.

title: Micronesia’s president accuses China of ‘political warfare’
description: Micronesia’s president accused China of “political warfare” in a letter to other national leaders and discussed switching diplomatic allegiance from China to Taiwan in exchange for $50 million.

title: Masks stay put in Japan even as 3-year request to wear them ends
description: Japan on Monday dropped its request for people to wear masks after three years, but hardly anything changed in the country that has had an extremely high regard for their effectiveness at anti-virus protection.

title: Moldova police say they foiled Russia-backed unrest plot
description: Police in Moldova said they foiled a plot by groups of Russia-backed actors who were trained to cause mass unrest during a Sunday protest against the country’s new pro-Western government.

title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse unlikely to have big impact in Asia
description: Analysts say the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank is not likely to have a major contagion effect in Asia, but one person says it could be seen as a “warning.”

title: China’s Xi wants bigger global role after Saudi-Iran deal
description: President Xi Jinping called Monday for China to play a bigger role in managing global affairs, after Beijing hosted talks that produced an agreement by Saudi Arabia and Iran to reopen diplomatic relations.

title: U.S. moves to protect all deposits at Silicon Valley Bank in bid to stem wider fallout
description: Silicon Valley Bank depositors will have access to "all of  their money," federal regulators announced on Sunday.

title: Iran claims prisoner swap with U.S.; U.S. calls it ‘cruel lie’
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates — Iran’s top diplomat claimed Sunday that a prisoner swap was near with the U.S., though he offered no evidence to support his assertion.

title: U.S.-South Korea drills begin after North tests submarine missiles
description: The South Korean and U.S. militaries launched their biggest joint exercises in years, as North Korea said it conducted submarine-launched cruise missile tests.

title: U.K. PM Rishi Sunak says China a ‘systemic challenge’ to world order
description: A more assertive China poses a “systemic challenge” to the global order, U.K. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak told NBC News on Sunday.
